001package imagingbook.pub.geometry.homography;
002
003import java.util.Locale;
004
005import org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Quaternion;
006import org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.threed.Rotation;
007import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.LUDecomposition;
008import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
009import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
010import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
011import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularValueDecomposition;
012
013import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
014import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;

016/**
017 * Static utility methods used for camera calibration.
018 * @author WB
019 *
020 */
021public class MathUtil {
022
023        static {
024                Locale.setDefault(Locale.US);
025        }
026
027        public static void print(String name, RealMatrix M) {
028                System.out.println(name);
029                for (int r = 0; r < M.getRowDimension(); r++) {
030                        RealVector row = M.getRowVector(r);
031                        System.out.println("  " + r + " " + row.toString());
032                }
033        }
034
035        public static void print(String name, RealVector v) {
036                System.out.println(name + v.toString());
037        }
038
039        // -------------------------------------------------------
040
041        public static RealVector[] getColumnVectors(RealMatrix M) {
042                final int ncols = M.getColumnDimension();
043                RealVector[] colVecs = new  RealVector[ncols];
044                for (int col = 0; col < ncols; col++) {
045                        colVecs[col] = M.getColumnVector(col);
046                }
047                return colVecs;
048        }
049
050        public static RealVector crossProduct3x3(RealVector A, RealVector B) {
051                final double[] a = A.toArray();
052                final double[] b = B.toArray();
053                final double[] c = {
054                                a[1] * b[2] - b[1] * a[2],
055                                a[2] * b[0] - b[2] * a[0],
056                                a[0] * b[1] - b[0] * a[1]
057                };
058                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(c);
059        }
060
061        public static double det(RealMatrix M) {
062                return new LUDecomposition(M).getDeterminant();
063        }
064
065        public static RealVector getRowPackedVector(RealMatrix A) {
066                double[][] AA = A.getData();
067                double[] V = new double[AA.length * AA[0].length];
068                int k = 0;
069                for (int i = 0; i < AA.length; i++) {
070                        for (int j = 0; j < AA[0].length; j++) {
071                                V[k++] = AA[i][j];
072                        }
073                }
074                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(V);
075        }
076
077        public static RealMatrix fromRowPackedVector(RealVector V, int rows, int columns) {
078                double[][] AA = new double[rows][columns];
079                double[] data = V.toArray();
080                int k = 0;
081                for (int i = 0; i < rows; i++) {
082                        for (int j = 0; j < columns; j++) {
083                                AA[i][j] = data[k++];
084                        }
085                }
086                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(AA);
087        }
088

130
131
132        /**               
133         * Finds a nontrivial solution (x) to the homogeneous linear system M . x = 0
134         * by singular-value decomposition. If M has more rows than columns, the
135         * system of equations is overdetermined. In this case the returned solution
136         * minimizes the residual ||M . x|| in the least-squares sense.
137         * 
138         * @param A     the original matrix.
139         * @return the solution vector x.
140         */
141        public static RealVector solveHomogeneousSystem(RealMatrix A) {
142                SingularValueDecomposition svd = new SingularValueDecomposition(A);
143                RealMatrix V = svd.getV();
144                RealVector x = V.getColumnVector(V.getColumnDimension() - 1);
145                return x;
146        }
147
148        public static double[] toHomogeneous(double[] cvec) {
149                double[] hvec = new double[cvec.length + 1];
150                for (int i = 0; i < cvec.length; i++) {
151                        hvec[i] = cvec[i];
152                        hvec[hvec.length - 1] = 1;
153                }
154                return hvec;
155        }
156
157        public static double[] toCartesian(double[] hvec) {
158                double[] cvec = new double[hvec.length - 1];
159                final double s = 1 / hvec[hvec.length - 1];     // TODO: check for zero factor
160                for (int i = 0; i < hvec.length - 1; i++) {
161                        cvec[i] = s * hvec[i];
162                }
163                return cvec;
164        }
165

192
193        public static String getInfo(double[][] A) {
194                return String.format("Matrix: rows=%d, columns=%d", A.length, A[0].length);
195        }
196
197        public static String getInfo(double[] x) {
198                return String.format("Vector: dimension=%d", x.length);
199        }
200
201        public static double mean(double[] x) {
202                final int n = x.length;
203                if (n == 0) 
204                        return 0;
205                double sum = 0;
206                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
207                        sum = sum + x[i];
208                }
209                return sum / n;
210        }
211
212        /**
213         * 
214         * @param x a sequence of real values 
215         * @return the variance of the values in x (sigma^2)
216         */
217        public static double variance(double[] x) {
218                final int n = x.length;
219                if (n == 0) 
220                        return 0;
221                double sum = 0;
222                double sum2 = 0;
223                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
224                        sum = sum + x[i];
225                        sum2 = sum2 + x[i] * x[i];
226                }
227                return (sum2 - (sum * sum) / n) / n;
228        }
229
230        public static RealMatrix getNormalisationMatrix(Pnt2d[] pnts) {
231                final int N = pnts.length;
232                double[] x = new double[N];
233                double[] y = new double[N];
234
235                for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
236                        x[i] = pnts[i].getX();
237                        y[i] = pnts[i].getY();
238                }
239
240                // calculate the means in x/y
241                double meanx = MathUtil.mean(x);
242                double meany = MathUtil.mean(y);
243
244                // calculate the variances in x/y
245                double varx = MathUtil.variance(x);
246                double vary = MathUtil.variance(y);
247
248                double sx = Math.sqrt(2 / varx);
249                double sy = Math.sqrt(2 / vary);
250
251                RealMatrix matrixA = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][] {
252                        { sx,  0, -sx * meanx},
253                        {  0, sy, -sy * meany},
254                        {  0,  0,           1 }});
255
256                return matrixA;
257        }
258
259
260        // Utility method
261        public static double[] transform(double[] p, RealMatrix M3x3) {
262                if (p.length != 2) {
263                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("transform(): vector p must be of length 2 but is " + p.length);
264                }
265                double[] pA = MathUtil.toHomogeneous(p);
266                double[] pAt = M3x3.operate(pA);
267                return MathUtil.toCartesian(pAt); // need to de-homogenize, since pAt[2] == 1?
268        }
269

294        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
295
296        public static Quaternion toQuaternion(Rotation r) {
297                return new Quaternion(r.getQ0(), r.getQ1(), r.getQ2(), r.getQ3());
298        }
299
300        public static Rotation toRotation(Quaternion q) {
301                return new Rotation(q.getQ0(), q.getQ1(), q.getQ2(), q.getQ3(), true);
302        }
303
304        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
305        
306        public static void main(String[] args) {
307                System.out.println("Solving A.x = 0 (for A being n x 3, exact and least squares)");
308                {
309                        double[][] A = {{1, 2, 3}, {4, 5, 6}, {9, 8, 0}};
310                        RealVector x = solveHomogeneousSystem(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A));
311                        System.out.println("\nA = \n" + Matrix.toString(A));
312                        System.out.println("Solution = " + x.toString());
313                        // Solution = {0.649964237; -0.7338780288; 0.1974070146}
314                }
315                {
316                        double[][] A = {{1, 2, 3}, {4, 5, 6}, {9, 8, 0}, {-3, 7, 2}};
317                        RealVector x = solveHomogeneousSystem(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A));
318                        System.out.println("\nA = \n" + Matrix.toString(A));
319                        System.out.println("Solution = " + x.toString());
320                        // Solution = {0.2311474408; -0.5001889485; 0.8344949828}
321                }
322
323        }
